data.title: McAfee adds to protection service with Sentrigo
data.meta_description: Sentrigo\'s flagship product, Hedgehog Enterprise, monitors databases for illegal or unauthorized activity.
data.meta_site_name: Federal News Network - Helping feds meet their mission.
data.text:
McAfee is acquiring database security firm Sentrigo. Sentrigo provides vulnerability management, database activity monitoring, and virtual patching technologies. A part of McAfee’s Security Innovation Alliance program, Sentrigo’s products were already offered under the McAfee brand. Info Security reports the move increases McAfee’s presence in the database security market, which is estimated to reach more than $600 million by 2012.

This story is part of Federal News Radio’s daily Cybersecurity Update brought to you by Tripwire. For more cybersecurity news, click here.
